title: How I Create Amazon Ads Using Publisher Rocket

tactics.name: Publisher Rocket Keyword Research
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to identify high-performing keywords for Amazon ads
steps: Access AMS keyword search tool in Publisher Rocket
caveats: Requires careful keyword selection to avoid irrelevant searches
source_quotes: You can use other author names and other author books.

tactics.name: keyword_match_types
tactics.description: Prioritize broad and phrase match keywords over exact match for Amazon Ads to balance cost and relevance.
steps: Use Publisher Rocket to identify suggested keywords
Add profitable keywords as positive matches
Add negative exact keywords for specific phrases
caveats: Exact match keywords may be too costly and restrictive
source_quotes: I don't usually bother with exact because that basically means someone has to search that exact term

heuristics.name: Daily Budget Optimization
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, boost ad spend
source_quotes: You can use as little as £2 per day.

heuristics.name: review_based_budgeting
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are less than 200, prioritize boosting high-potential keywords
source_quotes: I delete anything that says free because the book is not free

claims.statement: Amazon ads can generate consistent book sales for new authors
source_quotes: 2020 is really the year where I really started to go ham on Amazon ads.

claims.statement: Amazon Ads campaigns can be optimized using Publisher Rocket for keyword research and negative keyword targeting.
source_quotes: I'm going to add this as a negative exact keyword

niche_patterns.example: romance books + steamy content + no free content
niche_patterns.description: Target specific niches with clear content constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Avoids irrelevant searches while maintaining price competitiveness
source_quotes: If I didn't want my book to come up when someone searched this...
